dt: {bc}to prepare (beer, ale, etc.) by steeping, boiling, and fermentation or by infusion and fermentation
{bc}to prepare (a drink or other liquid) by infusion in hot water
{bc}to be in the process of forming

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}brēowan{/it}; akin to Latin {it}fervēre{/it} to boil {ma}{mat|barm|}{/ma}
shortdef: to prepare (beer, ale, etc.) by steeping, boiling, and fermentation or by infusion and fermentation

dt: {bc}a beverage (such as beer or coffee) that is brewed at home

dt.t: We arrive at happy hour, when the students who live on the farm and help sell the week's harvest at the market kick back with some {wi}home brew{/wi} after a hard day's work.

The company also has a brew school, which provides an accessible learning space for coffee novices and experienced baristas alike. Some of the classes offered include {wi}home brew{/wi} methods, espresso extraction, and latte art to name a few.

utxt.t: He also said health workers eliminated methanol or other toxins in {wi}home-brewed{/wi} alcoholic beverages.

shortdef: a beverage (such as beer or coffee) that is brewed at home
